page.title: 09Converted buildings,H.Lorton
page.content: There are several{converted {buildings}in High Lorton.The Village Hall was originally a{brewery}and the nearby building,now used to garage a car and for storage,was the brewery {stable.}'Midtown' was a{farmhouse,}but is now a holiday-cottage for rent,and its adjacent{barn}is now four holiday flatlets,having also been a garage and repair-shop for some years in between. The 'White Ash Barn' was also a barn before becoming a home,cafe and craft- shop,as was the house now simply called 'The Barn'. One of the main reasons for these conversions is that the area is within a{National Park,}so new building is greatly{restricted.}The newer homes are mostly bungalows built between 1930 and the present.Building that is allowed is almost always{in-fill,}so the village is{not increasing}in area.
